a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "f = (\<Sum>i = 1..2016. (2017 - i) / i)"
and h1 : "g = (\<Sum>i = 2..2017. 1 / i)"
shows  "f / g = 2017"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "f = (\<Sum>i = 1..2016. (2017 - i) / i)"
and h1 : "g = (\<Sum>i = 2..2017. 1 / i)"
shows  "f / g = 2017"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Consider two sums, $f$ and $g$, where $f$ is the sum of $(2017 - i)/i$ from $i = 1$ to $i = 2016$, and $g$ is the sum of $1/i$ from $i = 2$ to $i = 2017$. What is the ratio of $f$ to $g$? The final answer is $2017$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<in> {1..2016} \<longrightarrow> f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<in> {2..2017} \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "2017 = 2017"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<in> {1..2016} \<longrightarrow> f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<in> {2..2017} \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "2017 = 2017"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Assume that there are two functions $f$ and $g$ defined on the real numbers. For all numbers $n$ in the set from 1 to 2016, $f(n)$ equals the quotient of the difference between 2017 and $n$ divided by $n$. For all numbers $n$ in the set from 2 to 2017, $g(n)$ equals the reciprocal of $n$. If the ratio of the sum of $f(n)$ over the set from 1 to 2016 to the sum of $g(n)$ over the set from 2 to 2017 equals 2017, then prove that 2017 equals 2017.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n \<in> {1..2016}. f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n \<in> {2..2017}. g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "2017 = 2017"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n \<in> {1..2016}. f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n \<in> {2..2017}. g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "2017 = 2017"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Assume two functions $f$ and $g$ defined as $f(n) = \frac{2017-n}{n}$ for $n$ in the range $1$ to $2016$, and $g(n) = \frac{1}{n}$ for $n$ in the range $2$ to $2017$. If the ratio of the sum of $f(n)$ over its range to the sum of $g(n)$ over its range is equal to $2017$, confirm that $2017 = 2017$.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 2016"
and h1 : "sum (\<lambda>i. (2017 - i) / i) {1..n} / sum (\<lambda>i. 1 / (i + 1)) {1..n} = 2017"
shows  "n = 2016"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes n :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 2016"
and h1 : "sum (\<lambda>i. (2017 - i) / i) {1..n} / sum (\<lambda>i. 1 / (i + 1)) {1..n} = 2017"
shows  "n = 2016"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Given a natural number $n = 2016$, if the ratio of the sum from 1 to $n$ of $\frac{2017 - i}{i}$ to the sum from 1 to $n$ of $\frac{1}{i + 1}$ equals 2017, prove that $n = 2016$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. 2 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "True"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. 2 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "True"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given two functions $f$ and $g$ defined for all real numbers. $f(n)$ is defined as $\frac{2017-n}{n}$ for $1 \leq n \leq 2016$ and $g(n)$ is defined as $\frac{1}{n}$ for $2 \leq n \leq 2017$. The ratio of the sum of all $f(n)$ to the sum of all $g(n)$ for the specified ranges is $2017$. Is this statement true?

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> f n = n / (2017 - n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. 2 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> f n = n / (2017 - n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. 2 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: Given two functions, $f(n) = \frac{n}{2017-n}$ for $1 \leq n \leq 2016$ and $g(n) = \frac{1}{n}$ for $2 \leq n \leq 2017$, find the value of the ratio of the sum of $f(n)$ from $n=1$ to $2016$ over the sum of $g(n)$ from $n=2$ to $2017$. The final answer is $2017$.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 2 \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> g n = f n"
shows  "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 2 \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> g n = f n"
shows  "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: For all real numbers $n$ between 1 and 2016, inclusive, let $f(n) = \frac{2017 - n}{n}$. For all real numbers $n$ between 2 and 2017, inclusive, let $g(n) = \frac{1}{n}$. If $g(n) = f(n)$ for all $n$ between 1 and 2016, inclusive, find the ratio of the sum of $f(n)$ from $n=1$ to $n=2016$ to the sum of $g(n)$ from $n=2$ to $n=2017$. The final answer is 2017.

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "int \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> f n = n / (2017 - n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. 2 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
shows  "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "int \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> f n = n / (2017 - n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. 2 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 / n"
shows  "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {2..2017} = 2017"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: Given two functions, $f(n) = \frac{n}{2017 - n}$ for all integers $n$ in the range $1 \leq n \leq 2016$, and $g(n) = \frac{1}{n}$ for all integers $n$ in the range $2 \leq n \leq 2017$, what is the ratio of the sum of $f(n)$ over its domain to the sum of $g(n)$ over its domain? The final answer is $2017$.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> a n = n / (2017 - n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. 2 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> b n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum a {1..2016} / sum b {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "2017 = 2017"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2016 \<longrightarrow> a n = n / (2017 - n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. 2 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 2017 \<longrightarrow> b n = 1 / n"
and h2 : "sum a {1..2016} / sum b {2..2017} = 2017"
shows  "2017 = 2017"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: Given two sequences $a_n = \frac{n}{2017-n}$ for $1 \leq n \leq 2016$ and $b_n = \frac{1}{n}$ for $2 \leq n \leq 2017$, if the ratio of the sum of the sequence $a$ from $n=1$ to $n=2016$ to the sum of the sequence $b$ from $n=2$ to $n=2017$ equals $2017$, then prove that $2017 = 2017$.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. g n = 1 / (n+1)"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {1..2016} = 2017"
shows  "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {1..2016} = 2017"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Determine the value of
\[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}}.\] The final Answer is 2017
 ### Proof
 We can write \begin{align} \frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} &= \frac{2017 - 1}{1} + \frac{2017 - 2}{2} + \frac{2017 - 3}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017 - 2016}{2016} \\
 &= \frac{2017}{1} - 1  +\frac{2017}{2} - 1 + \frac{2017}{3} - 1 + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 1 \\ &= \frac{2017}{1} + \frac{2017}{2} + \frac{2017}{3} + \dots + \frac{2017}{2016} - 2016 \\ &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} \right) + 1 \\
 &= 2017 \left( \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016} + \frac{1}{2017} \right). \end{align}Therefore, \[\frac{\frac{2016}{1} + \frac{2015}{2} + \frac{2014}{3} + \dots + \frac{1}{2016}}{\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{4} + \dots + \frac{1}{2017}} = \boxed{2017}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. f n = (2017 - n) / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. g n = 1 / (n+1)"
and h2 : "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {1..2016} = 2017"
shows  "sum f {1..2016} / sum g {1..2016} = 2017"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Given two sequences where the nth term of the first sequence is given by $f(n) = \frac{2017-n}{n}$ and the nth term of the second sequence is given by $g(n) = \frac{1}{n+1}$, find the ratio of the sum of the first 2016 terms of the first sequence to the sum of the first 2016 terms of the second sequence. The final answer is 2017.
